title: As the game progresses, I start to try things I'm not good at, so questions and tips guys! Pls :)
body:
Nidalee and Evelynn Jungle is not something I'm used to doing, but, I quite enjoy it. The only problem is, I literally can't do a full jungle clear without dying or backing. Tips? Starting items, starting abilities, strategies, runes etc.

I've played AD Carry maybe like 5 times in the past two years, I don't really enjoy it as much but I know I'll have to do it in Ranked eventually. Can you guys tell me what the most _common_ builds are on Vayne, Lucian, Tristana and Ezreal? Obviously I'll change these things according to the game.

replies.body:
Remember when Evelyn had a stun.those were the days

Also I wouldn't suggest you wait till you get stuck with adc in rank,get some norms playtime in, but I find if you have 3-4 prefs you'll rarely get stuck playing adc.

I personally don't like the current state Evelynn is in right now, simply because of her low sustain in Jungle. Also, I don't play much Evelynn, so I shouldn't be the one telling you how to play her.

However, Nidalee has quite good sustain in Jungle and her clear isn't too shabby as well. With Nidalee, I recommend starting with Hunter's Talisman, Refillable Potion and a normal trinket ward, of course. Starting Q is recommended, then W, then E. Max Q first, then E. Use Javelin Toss (human form Q) and Bushwhack (human form W) to help kite the big monster in the jungle camps, as they stop the target for a brief period of time and also heal whenever you can. 

Pretty much, you want to be kiting as much as you can during early clears. 
For melee big monsters, this is a full rotation, start in human form, use Q and place your trap next to it (for kiting after cougar form), use heal if you're not full health, switch to cougar form, then W>E>Q, switch back to human form and kite the monster into your trap then auto attack and repeat process once monster is within melee range of you again. 
For ranged big monsters, they aren't very tough to kill, so just repeat the same process, but there's no need for kiting.
(If someone finds an error in this paragraph above, please correct it).

For runes, go 3x flat AP Quints / 9x flat Armor Seals / 9x flat AD Marks / 9x flat AP Glyphs - There are a few different rune pages for Nidalee jungle, but I found this one to be the most effective for early game (which the current meta is early game based).

For masteries, use these --> http://imgur.com/6R2IioP

I recommend getting Skirmisher's Sabre into Runeglaive ASAP and getting normal boots then Rod of Ages. After Rod of Ages, upgrade your boots into Lucidity boots. You don't have to wait until you have Rod of Ages to upgrade your boots, but I recommend it. You then build according to the game, but to give some examples of possible items: Zhonyas Hourglass, Abyssal Scepter, Void Staff and Rabadon's Deathcap. If you reach full build, you can sell your Runeglaive and purchase Lich Bane if you wish, but it's unlikely your game will reach that stage in this early game based meta.

You can upgrade your Refillable Potion into Hunter's Potion if you want, but I rarely do.

Strategies? Land your Javelin Toss. Kappa :) You can also Javelin Toss over walls into camps, then Pounce over, to same some time. Early clears, you should focus the small monsters first on the Wolf, Raptor and Krug camps. DON'T FORGET YOU JAVELIN TOSS AND BUSHWHACK STOPS MONSTERS FROM MOVING!!! SwiftRage
Also, once you get Sheen procs from Sheen and Runeglaive, try get every spell you do to proc it. So that means waiting for the cooldown to go then using another spell, to maximise damage.



And for ADC builds, just look at: www.probuilds.net . This shows how a lot of professionals build on champions. Try to look at more recent games by professionals.

Good luck!!! {{champion:17}}
